pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.2: That is, four finger-breadths, _caturaṅgula_. 7 cm is based on my calculation of the _aṅgula_, “the fingerbreadth”, as 1.7 cm. For further explanation, see comment at _bhikkhu-saṅghādisesa_ 6.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.15: _Sugata-cīvara-ppamāṇaṃ_, “the _sugata_ robe measure,” . The _sugata_ measures are standard measures, and I translate accordingly.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.16: That is, nine standard hand-spans (_sugata-vidatthi_) by six standard hand-spans. The metric measures given here are based on my own estimate of the _sugata-vidatthi_; see comment at _bhikkhu-saṅghādisesa_ 6. A robe size of 3.6 times 5.4 meters is unreasonably large and is the result of the commentarial explanation of the standard measures being three times those of normal people. It is likely, therefore, that the standard measures would have been smaller at a pre-commentarial point in Budddhist history. However, there are no other indications of the standard measures in the Pali text.
